title: John Andelin
text:

title: About Me
text:
I am a Statistics student at Brigham Young University with an emphasis in applied statistics and analytics. I am interested in using data to solve real-world problems, particularly in health, public safety, and scientific research contexts. I enjoy building statistical models, designing reproducible workflows, and translating complex analyses into clear, actionable insights.
Through coursework, research, and professional experience, I have developed a strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data science tools across R and Python ecosystems.

title: About Me
text:
Brigham Young University — Provo, UT
Bachelor of Science in Statistics (Applied Statistics & Analytics)
Expected Graduation: April 2027
GPA: 3.4
Relevant Coursework - Analysis of Variance
- Probability & Statistical Inference
- Linear Regression Modeling
- Predictive Analytics & Machine Learning
- Data Visualization (Tableau)
- Data Science Ecosystems (SQL, Python, Linux, AWS)
- Calculus and Linear Algebra
- Data Structures (C++)
Involvement - Member, Statistics Club
- Statistics Department Teaching Assistant

title: About Me
text:
Statistics Department — Teaching Assistant
Brigham Young University | Jan 2025 – Present

Assist students with probability, statistical modeling, and programming in R and Python

Provide one-on-one conceptual and coding support

Support course logistics using Canvas and BYU Learning Suite

Strengthened communication skills through technical instruction

title: About Me
text:

Brigham Young University | Aug 2024 – Dec 2024

Inspected university laboratories for OSHA compliance

Conducted HAZCAT testing on unknown substances

Maintained detailed safety and compliance records

Demonstrated strong attention to detail and data accuracy

title: About Me
section: Summit Nutritional Laboratories — Physical Chemistry QC Technician
text:
Summit Nutritional Laboratories — Physical Chemistry QC Technician
Spanish Fork, UT | Dec 2022 – Sep 2023

Performed quality control testing on nutraceutical products

Prepared samples for inductively coupled plasma (ICP) analysis

Followed strict laboratory protocols and documentation standards

title: About Me
text:

Collected and analyzed experimental data across washing and drying cycles

Produced data visualizations and statistical summaries

title: About Me
text:
Forest Cover Prediction

Built a machine learning pipeline in R to predict forest cover types

Performed feature engineering, preprocessing, and normalization

Developed and ensembled XGBoost, LightGBM, and Random Forest models

Achieved strong predictive performance on held-out test data
